intro: Tanaecium affine, commonly known as the slender tanaecium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Tanaecium affine is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
